Answers.Answer: Come to a complete stop
Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

False

stopping at traffic signals

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
1 metre from the left-hand kerb

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top centre of the windscreen

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter

Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead without stopping
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: What is the speed limit from the time you pass an Accident sign until you are past the crash site?

Answers.Answer: 20km/h
30km/h
40km/h
50km/h

Question: What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Drive up onto the footpath
Pull over and allow it to pass
Keep driving as you were

the vehicle in front is going faster than the speed limit

Question: What is the safest way to drive up to intersections?

Looking to the left

Question: You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on

Use the centre line as a guide
Turn your vehicle park lights on

Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
